intro: Streptocarpus pole-evansii, commonly known as the Pole-Evans streptocarpus, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family native to South Africa. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its upright growth habit and attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to white. The leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow under proper conditions. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
